instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2530 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message:
Got one more of these old 820-2530 boards. I have all main power rails and I have [FONT=Courier]PM_SLP_S4_L. When pressing power I only get 0,78V on PM_SLP_S3_L should be 3.3 I think.

There is no short to ground and all the enable resistors and capacitors on this line is fine.

Is this bad SMC? [/FONT]

threads.title: 820-2530 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message: That is ok. Voltage before and after R7859?

threads.title: 820-2530 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message: Both sides the same 0.106, which is what I get everywhere i measure PM_SLP_S3_L when i press the power button. It raised from 0 to 0.1V when button is pressed. One more thing i wrote the wrong value i the first post it should be 0.078-0.1V.

threads.title: 820-2530 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message: Are you using a 85W charger?  SMC_ADAPTER_EN high?

threads.title: 820-2530 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message: Yes, a genuine Apple 85W charger, SMC_ADAPTER_EN =3.39V

threads.title: 820-2530 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message:
[QUOTE="XooP, post: 2209"]Yes, a genuine Apple 85W charger, SMC_ADAPTER_EN =3.39V[/QUOTE]

Im writing from a mac with that board right now, and it uses a 60W charger.

threads.title: 820-2530 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message: Shouldn't matter if the charger can handle more than 60W. If I was using a 45W charger, then it could be an issue.

threads.title: 820-2530 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message:
No! 15" board will NOT power on from anything else than an 85W charger!

I have no more ideas about this one really, any history on this board, water?

threads.title: 820-2530 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message: You know this is a 13 inch board? And yes it was as originally water damaged

threads.title: 820-2530 no PM_SLP_S3_L
threads.message: Well, I'll try to reflow the SMC before it goes into the donor bin :)
